What is the structure of artificial vanilla??

shaking vanilla flavoring (vanillin=aldehyde) with saturated aqueous sodium bisulfite (available at wine making supply shops as Sodium Metabisulfite, which reacts with H2O to form bisulfite) will form a solid aldehyde-sulfite sodium salt adduct  precipitate, which is filtered and washed with cold water and/or EtOH. Repeated aldehyde adduct precipitations may be in order to complete extraction. Then react the cleaned aldehyde adduct with dilute HCl or NaOH to recover free aldehyde and extract with DCM in a sep funnel just as done in this video. Thus can lead to remarkably clean product in nearly quantitative yields.

Hello Nile, I was watching your video and I noticied that the NMR spectrum cant be vainillin, F should be a singlet and looking bibliography I confirmed that the spectrum of vaillin is not the one displayed.
Then, seeing the multiplicity of F, I had the idea that it looked like a methylene(-CH2-) next to a methyl, attached to a oxygen, for the high chemical shift. Such CH3 should appear in the spectrum in a chemical shift lower than the 2.5 where you cut the spectrum, so it makes me wonder if you have another peak that you aren't showing. For last, I looked a spectrum of Ethylvanillin and all the peaks are very close from your spectrum, aside for a peak around 1.5 that integrates for 3H.
I await your response.
your NMR interpretation is completely wrong..  In F position you should have a single peak and it should at 3.7 not 4.2...
